Given three integers A, B and P, find the number of roots of the equation 
x^3 = 1 mod P in the interval [A,B], endpoints inclusive.

INPUT
First line contains T, number of test cases. Then T lines followEach testcase is described by three space-separated integers in a single line, A B and P.

OUTPUT
For each testcase, output a single line containing the answer to the given problem.

CONSTRAINTS
1≤T≤1001≤A,B≤10^181≤P≤100000
SAMPLE INPUT
21 100 21 100 31
SAMPLE OUTPUT
5011
